thread.title: France's Canal+ suspends broadcasts of TF1 channels in fee feud

title: France's Canal+ suspends broadcasts of TF1 channels in fee feud
text: March 2, 2018 / 6:53 AM / Updated 3 minutes ago France's Canal+ suspends broadcasts of TF1 channels in fee feud Reuters Staff 1 Min Read PARIS (Reuters) - France’s Canal+ media group, part of Vivendi, says it is suspending broadcasts of channels owned by TF1, saying the latter is imposing“unreasonable” fees on its distributors. 70th Cannes Film Festival - Cannes, France. 16/05/2017 - The logo of French television channel Canal+ is seen on the Croisette. REUTERS/Eric Gaillard “The Canal+ group reasserts its wish to be able to broadcast Groupe TF1’s free channels but does not intend to pay in order to transmit them,” Canal+ said in a statement, adding that it was taking the case to a commercial court in Paris. TF1, part Bouygues, is already engaged in a legal tussle with Orange over a similar fee dispute. Reporting by Bertrand Boucey, Writing by Sarah White, Editing by Brian Love
